sentences: Nikolaos "Nikos" Oikonomopoulos (Greek: Νικολάος Νίκος Οικονομόπουλος, pronounced [nikoˈlaoz ˈnikos ikonoˈmopulos]; born 30 June 1984) is a Greek singer.
section: N/A

sentences: He appeared on Greek talent show Dream Show - The Music 2, of which he was the winner.
section: N/A

sentences: Nikos Oikonomopoulos is top contemporary male singer in the latter half of the decade with huge number of album sales.

== Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: Nikos Oikonomopoulos was born on 30 June 1984 in Patra.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: He has grown up in a town outside Patras, Kato Achaia.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: He sang in different cities, initially in the Peloponnese and then in Northern Greece.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: Along with the song did other jobs, such as fishing and pizzeria.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: In December 2006 emerged as the winner of the reality of Alpha TV show, "Dream Show - the Music 2".
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===
== Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: His first studio album was released on 15 November 2007 titled Proti Agapi (First Love).
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: From this album several songs have been successful, such as "Ola Gia Sena" ("Everything For You"), "Den Eisia Entaxei" ("You Are Not Okay"), "Koita Na Mathaineis" ("Look To Learn") and "Afto To Asteri" ("This Star").
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: In June 2008 he won the award for "Best New Artist" at the MAD Video Music Awards 2008.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: In December 2008 released maxi single titled "Kai Mi Girizeis" (And Do Not Come Back) and his second studio album titled Akousa… (I Heard), which went gold.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: In June 2009 he won the award for "Best Contemporary Laiko Video Clip" with the song "Ola Gia Sena" at the  MAD Video Music Awards 2009.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: In December 2009 Oikonomopoulos released Katathesi Psihis (Deposit Soul) which gained a platinum certification.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: It contained many hits like "Ti Tha Kano Me Sena" ("What Am I Going To Do With You"), "Katathesi Psihis" ("Deposit Soul"), "Mou 'Pe Mia Psihi" ("I Told Me A Soul") and "Enas Theos Kserei" ("Only God Knows").
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: In winter Nikos Oikonomopolos signed with Minos EMI.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: In the summer of 2010, he worked with Kostas Martakis at Thea and in the winter at Fix with Nino and Ioakeim Fokas.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: On 3 December 2010, Oikonomopoulos released his fourth studio album titled Doro Gia Sena (A Present For You).
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: The album achieved platinum certification from its first week.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

sentences: It eventually became triple platinum in 2011.
section: == Biography == | === 2007–2010: Debut album and rise in popularity ===

== Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: In December 2011 the album Tha Eimai Edo (I'm will be here) was released.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: Big hits from the album were the songs "Kai Ti Egine" ("So What"), "Kali Kardia" ("Good Heart"), "Psaxe me" ("Search Me") and "Exartimenos" ("Addict").
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: That same year, Oikonomopoulos performed at Fever for the winter season with Despina Vandi and Elli Kokkinou.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: The album has been certified double platinum for one week.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: In the summer of 2012, Oikonopoulos worked with Peggy Zina at Thea.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: On September 2012 Tha Eimai Edo was certified four times platinum.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: That same year was released Ennoeitai (It's Understood).
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: The album was certified double platinum sales.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: On 6 December 2013, Oikonomopoulos released new album Eilikrina (Sincerely).
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: The album has with multiple hits such as "Exaitias Sou" ("Because of You"), "Mi Figeis Tora" ("Do Not Leave Now"), "Se Lipamai" ("I Feel Sorry
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: For You") and "Na Skepazesai Ta Vradia" ("Covering The Nights").
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: On 16 December Eilikrina went double platinum and Ennoeitai four times platinum.
section: == Biography == | === 2011–2013: Tha Eimai Edo, Ennoeitai and Eilikrina ===

sentences: In the summer of 2014, Oikonomopoulos has concert series at Thea with Lena Papadopoulou.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: On 17 November same year, Oikonomopoulos released eighth album called Gia Hilious Logous (Because Of Thousand Reasons).
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: First two singles "Pote" ("Never") and "Gia Hilious Logous" had great success, the album stands at four times platinum in Greece.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: In 2015 Oikonomopoulos presented his new song "An Ponas" ("If You Suffer").
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: The song was first massive hit of his new album Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego (One Microphone And I), released on 17 December.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: The album going multiplatinum in Greece.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: Oikonomopoulou's new single called "Einai Kati Laika" ("It's Something Laic") is a written by Giorgos Sabanis and Eleni Giannatsoulia.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: The song premiered in Greek Radios on 7 November 2016.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: In October 2017 was released the song "Gia Kapoio Logo" ("For Some Reason"), written again by Sabanis and Giannatsoulia.
section: == Biography == | === 2014–present: Gia Hilious Logous, Ena Mikrofono Ki Ego and 10 ===

sentences: The song is one of the most viewed Greek songs on YouTube.
